body.name: Garmin nuvi 2797LMT 7-Inch Portable Bluetooth Vehicle GPS with Lifetime Maps and Traffic (Renewed)

climatePledgeFriendly.details: Pre-owned Certified: Electronics products are inspected, cleaned and (if applicable) repaired to excellent functional standards. Buying Pre-owned extends a product's life, reducing e-waste and raw material extraction.

features: Easy-to-use touchscreen interface. Lifetime traffic receiver embedded in 12V power adaptor (included in package)
Garmin Real Directions with Garmin Real Voice guide using recognizable buildings and landmarks
PhotoReal and Bird's Eye junction views offer detailed images of junctions along your route, to ease the stress of merging on or off a roadway
Up Ahead displays nearby services info -including restaurants, stores, hospitals and fuel -alongside your map and updates as you drive your route

Note: The unit itself will state “2797LM” on the back and not “2797LMT” because the traffic receiver is in the power adaptor and not the unit. The 12V adaptor needs to be plugged into the back of the unit in order to receive traffic updates. This product is NOT for trucking.
body.description: nüvi 2797LMT arrives with a bright 7.0" display and loaded with detailed maps of North America. With free lifetime¹ map updates, your routes are sure to reflect the most up-to-date maps, POIs (points of interest) and navigation information. New maps are available for download up to 4 times per year, for the life of your device, with no fees. With so much data, nüvi 2797LMT makes it easy to find addresses and millions of POIs such as businesses, stores, restaurants and other destinations. nüvi 2797LMT arrives preloaded with POIs, so there’s no need for you to enter that address information. Just select one — or many — and navigate there, quickly and easily. You also have the ability to add custom POIs to your nüvi 2797LMT.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works like Brand New
reviews.reviewText: Works perfect, I am very happy with this purchase. I have bought 2 refurbished Garmin units this year and they look and perform like brand new! Consider the savings of a refurbished unit and don't be afraid to buy one. They are just like new when you get them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I have used GPS in the past and many people that I have spoken to recommend the Garmin units
reviews.reviewText: Used it on a recent trip and found it to work as expected. I have used GPS in the past and many people that I have spoken to recommend the Garmin units.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Easier to see, klutzier to use than my older model
reviews.reviewText: The plus is that the screen is bright and easy to see, and has good touch sensitivity. Much better than my old 5 inch nuvi 755T. It also locks onto GPS satellites faster then the old one.The negatives are that it seems to take far longer to locate traffic information than the 755T did. Also, it requires many more steps to switch between a normal map and a traffic map - traffic map is now accessible only as an app.Finally, a bit of care is required when holding the unit - if you press the screen the wrong way while looking at a map, the unit offers to make the point of your press a new destination, which you usually don't want!Overall, an improvement over my old unit, especially if I intend to consult it while driving.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars it is a perfect upgrade from my 4 year-old Garmin
reviews.reviewText: Wow, it is a perfect upgrade from my 4 year-old Garmin. It is much bigger with better maps. The estimated time of arrival is handy as well as the icons for banking, restaurants, etc., along your route. It does not say "make a u-turn", make a u-turn" like the old, old variety of GPS units. It simply plots a new route for you. The traffic automatic re-routing is most helpful. I hate to sit in traffic, so it warns you about traffic conditions and simply finds a better way around them.The big size makes it easier to read and follow my customized little silver coupe along my route. The Help button actually helps out when you don't know how to do something without resorting the the well-written user manual.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2016
reviews.reviewText: Lot of problems. An Arizona all the address we do not get. We have to use phone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I thought a bigger screen would be better, but find 7" too big for my car
reviews.reviewText: I thought a bigger screen would be better, but find 7" too big for my car. Fits much better in husbands pick up. Works great. Much improvement in voice, no more annoying "recalculating". Sound is close to normal speech. Updating to 2015 maps was easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Does not pick up very many FM stations at all ...
reviews.reviewText: Does not pick up very many FM stations at all when compared to American spec radio. I even tried replacing my factory antenna with an after market, powered antenna without any improvement.Also, the bluetooth function stopped connecting to ANY device within 24 hours of using it.It does not recognize any music or apps on my iPhone 6S when I try to plug my phone directly into the front panel or rear port.Save your money and buy an American radio instead of this product from China

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A 7" large screen with many voice commands
reviews.reviewText: This is a re-conditioned unit which seemed fine upon my initial inspection. After some use, the speaker crackles a bit and the mic does not work as well when driving on a highway or interstate. The unit will do many things if you take the time to set it up proerly and learn the functions. There are also numerous youtype widows specifically on this model which are helpful. The screen is large (7"). Instead of putting it in the center of my front windshield as I did with my previous 5" unit, I placed it at the top of the window just below the visor on the driver's side. It does not obstruct my view and is easy to use. Rarely do I even need to touch the screen.
